title: How to Make Hand-Spun & Hand-Pulled Cotton Candy

steps.title: Combine the sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat.
steps.content: Combine the sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Place 4 cups of sugar, 1 cup of corn syrup, 1 cup of water, and 1/4 tsp. of salt into the saucepan and stir the ingredients together until the sugar is melted. Use a pastry brush to wipe down the sides of the pan to keep sugar crystals from forming.

steps.title: Clip on a candy thermometer and heat the mixture to 320°F (160°C).
steps.content: Clip on a candy thermometer and heat the mixture to 320°F (160°C). Then, pour the hot liquid into a shallow and heatproof container. Then, add the extract and food coloring that you're using and stir the ingredients well. Though this recipe calls for raspberry extract and pink food coloring, you can use any extract or food coloring you want.

steps.title: Line parchment over your work table.
steps.content: Line parchment over your work table. You can also spread it on the floor so it will catch any bits of falling sugar that may go over the table.

steps.title: Spin the sugar.
steps.content: Spin the sugar. Dip the decapitated whisk into the sugar syrup. Hold it over the pot and allow the sugar to drip back into the container for just a second. Hold it about one foot (30 cm) above the parchment and swing it back and forth so that very thin strands of sugar begin to fall on the paper. Keep going a few more times until you've got a nice looking nest of spun sugar. Know that it won't look like the machine cotton candy you're used to.

steps.title: Wrap the cotton candy around lollipop sticks.
steps.content: Wrap the cotton candy around lollipop sticks. You should do this right away, or the sugar will get brittle and would bend around the sticks.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. This is a dish best enjoyed immediately, but you can also seal it in air-tight containers to keep the moisture away from the cotton candy.

steps.title: Combine the ingredients in a medium saucepan.
steps.content: Combine the ingredients in a medium saucepan. Place 4 1/3 cups of sugar, 2 cups of water, 1 tsp. of vinegar, 1/2 cup of corn syrup and 1 drop of food coloring in the pan. Stir them together very gently so you don't end up forming any sugar crystals on the side of the pan. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Bring the mixture to a boil.
steps.content: Bring the mixture to a boil. Use a candy thermometer and watch it closely until it reaches 268°F (131°C). Then, remove it from the heat and allow it to cool until it gets down to 212°F (100°C).

steps.title: Divide the candy evenly into four 1-quart plastic containers.
steps.content: Divide the candy evenly into four 1-quart plastic containers.

steps.title: Remove it from the containers once it reaches room temperature.
steps.content: Remove it from the containers once it reaches room temperature. Do this by squeezing it gently while you carefully turn the container.

steps.title: Sprinkle a generous amount of cornstarch on a baking sheet.
steps.content: Sprinkle a generous amount of cornstarch on a baking sheet. The baking sheet should have sides.

steps.title: Roll the candy in the cornstarch.
steps.content: Roll the candy in the cornstarch. Rub off any excess that you see.

steps.title: Prepare the candy for pulling.
steps.content: Prepare the candy for pulling. Make a hole in the center of the candy. Use your thumb and forefingers to burrow a hole in the center of the candy. Then, use pressure to make the circle bigger, while the candy remains the same thickness around the rope you've made. Once the rope is long enough, twist it into a figure eight and bring both of the halves together.

steps.title: Pull the candy.
steps.content: Pull the candy. Hold the candy in both fists. Keep your front hand stable while your back hand pulls back gently. Rotate your hands around the candy and keep on pulling until the strands are nice and long. Keep pulling the candy at least 10-14 times.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Enjoy this delicious pulled candy while it's in good shape.
